data.actual_result: It's inconsistent: putting `#` doesn't make channel suggestions but the filter actually works, without `#` it does make suggestions but doesn't work after typing manually.
data.expected_result: It should be consistent: whether you decide to put `#` or not, if it **does** make channel suggestions, then the filter **should** work no matter if you finish to type the channel name manually or pick a suggestion. If it doesn't, then it shouldn't.
data.short_description: Putting the `#` symbol after the "in:" search filter doesn't display suggestions, but the filter actually works when you finish to type the channel name by hand, and vice versa
data.steps_to_repro: - In any text channel or DM, click the Search option to open the searchbar - type `in:` to place a channel filter, then place the `#` symbol and start to type the channel name. Observe that it doesn't display suggestions.  - Now, finish to type the desired channel name manually and click Search. Notice that the filter actually works.  - Then, make a new search and insert the `in:` filter again, but this time don't use `#` symbol. When you start to type channel name, it does make suggestions, but the filter doesn't work if you manually finish to type the channel name.
